page.title: 01GENERAL PAGE,DUNTISBOURNE
page.content: {VILLAGES}Winstone,Duntisbourne Abbots and Leer. {PEOPLE PER HECTARE }0.3 {PARISHES}North Cerney,Duntisbourne Abbots and Rous ,Winstone {GEOLOGY}These Cotswold hills are gently tilted Jurassic rock,mainly Oolitic limestone and some clays. {DRAINAGE}The two rivers in the area, supplied by spring water,both drain towards the SE.On the SW of the A417 flows the River Dunt and on the NW a tributary of the River Churn flows through a steep-sided valley. {ROADS}The main road which bisects the block is the A417 which follows the line of the Roman Road ,Ermin Way. Other roads are narrow and winding. {HOUSING}Mainly Cotswold stone cottages and farms ,some new development but limited.
